title: AI Coding In-browser Text to Speech With Aider
summary: This workflow demonstrates a 'zero-code' approach to building a full-stack web application. By feeding external documentation (MDN Web Docs) into an AI coding agent (Aider), the developer orchestrates the creation of a frontend interface and a Python Flask backend. The process highlights the power of context injection, iterative refinement through natural language, and agentic file management to prototype functional software rapidly.

steps.reasoning: Locating authoritative documentation (Web Speech API) to serve as the ground truth for the AI agent.
Copying documentation into a text file (`tts-docs.txt`) and adding it to Aider's context ensures the agent generates code using correct, up-to-date APIs.
Prompting the agent to generate the core HTML and JavaScript logic based specifically on the provided documentation file.
Directing the agent to consolidate files (moving JS into HTML) to simplify the project structure via natural language commands.
Expanding the application stack by asking the agent to create a server-side Flask app to host the frontend.
Instructing the agent to move `index.html` to a `templates` directory to adhere to Flask's specific directory structure requirements.
Manual intervention to clean up git status and ignore cache files, correcting state issues the agent encountered during file moves.
Requesting the agent to generate a `requirements.txt` file to ensure the Python environment is correctly configured for the generated app.
Refining the application by asking the agent to add specific UI elements (buttons, textareas) and wire them to the existing logic.

key_takeaways: Context Injection is Critical: Providing raw documentation (MDN) allows the AI to implement specific APIs correctly without hallucinating syntax.
Natural Language Refactoring: Aider can handle structural changes (moving files, merging code blocks) just as easily as writing new code.
Iterative Prototyping: The workflow moves from a basic script to a hosted Flask app with UI improvements entirely through conversational prompts.
Human-in-the-Loop: While the agent handles coding, the human operator is necessary for resolving git state conflicts and verifying runtime environments.
